shiny.react 0.0.1
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

ShinyComponentWrapper()

Shiny Component Wrapper

enable_react_debug_mode()

Sets shiny.react into DEBUG mode.

html_dependency_react()

Shiny React dependency adding React libs.

html_dependency_shiny_react()

Shiny React JS dependency.

input_class_name()

Returns a CSS class name used to select DOM elements when installing Shiny input bindings. It must be indentical to the name returned by inputClassName() in shiny-react.jsx.

make_input()

Make Shiny input

make_output()

Make Shiny output

mark_as_react_tag()

Mark as React tag

needs_shiny_component_wrapper()

Should return TRUE iff a tag should be wrapped in a ShinyComponentWrapper

prepare_tags_for_serialization()

This function does several things needed before a tag tree can be transformed into JSON:

  1. Remove all html_dependency nodes.

  2. Rename some attributes in React nodes to ensure they do not become controlled components.

  3. Remove names so that lists serialize into arrays and not objects.

  4. Add ShinyComponentWrapper around Shiny inputs and outputs

reactOutput()

Shiny binding for shiny.react HTML widget

reactWidget()

Creates a Shiny React widget that can be then rendered on the client with React

rename_attribs_to_uncontrolled()

Rename controlled attributes to uncontrolled

renderReact()

Shiny binding for shiny.react HTML widget

serialize_shiny_react_tags()

Serialize JS-wrapped attributes directly into the representation to be executed on the client.

update_input()

Update Shiny input

withReact()

Use arbitrary React components and props in R.
